answers.answer: Oh and I get morning erections what seems about 50% of the time and they're pretty weak too.  They didn't used to be so weak.

question: I'm 23 and I'm having impotence.  I frequently am unable to get an erection.  I am almost 100% sure it's not psychological because I've had a steady girlfriend and I'm plenty confident, etc.  If I am able to get one, it's really weak and if I put on a condom I lose it often.  They used to be very hard just a year ago and now the head isn't nearly as hard and it just feels weaker in general.  If it does get up, it needs to be stimulated pretty quickly or it'll go back down.  Last year I could have one with virtually no stimulation and stay hard for 10+ minutes no problem.I've had my testosterone tested and I'm on the high side of normal.  When flaccid/limp it feels like blood is constantly pushed out and it doesn't stay as 'full' as I'm used to...almost like it's always cold or shriveled.  I had one girlfriend who bent it downward fairly hard and it hurt a few times.  I think I have a family history of prostate cancer but I didn't think that would develop until I was older.I don't smoke, I exercise regularly, no diabetes, great health.  I had taken adderall pretty regularly and had problems but that usually went away in a day.  I haven't taken it in 3+ months now.  I guess it just doesn't feel normal anymore, like something physical is different.  Even masturbating is difficult and porn barely turns me on.
title: Impotence in 23 year old (ED)
